componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
{{#if Recipient.FirstName}} Assalamu alaykum Dear {{Recipient.FirstName}}, {{else}} Assalamu alaykum {{/if}}

The bombings that devastated Gaza in May caused a devastating loss of life. But they also shattered Gaza’s already overwhelmed infrastructure, making it all but impossible for Palestinians to recover and rebuild.

Those 11 days of airstrikes destroyed the wastewater system, sending sewage flooding into Gaza’s streets. Utter devastation continues for the 250,000 people who no longer have access to clean water, because of bombing that put Gaza’s only desalination plant out of use. And a staggering 800,000 people have had their water pipes cut off.

Families in Gaza are in urgent need of sustainable clean water.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
£18 – Reconnect 3 people to Gaza’s water network, improving health and reducing water contamination. 

£30 – Provide 2 people with sustainable clean water by helping to build a desalination plant

£40 – Protect a family from COVID-19 with kit containing hand sanitizer, soap, masks, gloves, wipes, disinfectant, detergent, toilet paper, shampoo, toothpaste, toothbrushes, and sponges.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value: Slowly poisoning Gaza’s children

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Even before the war, 97% of water in Gaza was too contaminated for human consumption, forcing families to spend 1/3 of their incomes on water trucking – but even this water is estimated to have high levels of contamination.

In Gaza, the lack of access to clean water, that most basic of human rights, kills. The UN estimates that a staggering 12% of children’s deaths in Gaza are related to dirty water.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value: "We had to drink salty water"

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value: 42-year-old Maha knows this danger all too well. It’s a continuous struggle to provide water to her five children, especially since being widowed eight years ago.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
“Tap water at home is so salty that it’s undrinkable. We use it only for washing and cleaning ourselves but it’s not safe to drink. That’s why we have to buy water from a water seller.

I don’t have enough money to meet my children’s needs. 

“During attacks, the water seller couldn’t bring water immediately. We had to drink salty water for 2 or 3 days and wait until he came [to our neighbourhood] to refill our water containers.  I hope that the generous people [hearing this] can fulfil the needs of vulnerable families with projects for children to help them have a good future. I wish to see my children as doctors or engineers, not jobless on the streets. 

“Now with coronavirus, instead of buying disinfectant, we use water and chlorine to clean and protect ourselves. There isn’t enough money to buy hygiene items.”

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value: Help heal Gaza

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
The latest escalation also destroyed Gaza’s only COVID-19 testing facility, and damaged 14 clinics and hospitals, putting Palestinians at even further ongoing risk.

With your help, we’re rehabilitating and maintaining damaged and deteriorated wastewater networks, and connecting houses to the network, improving long-term hygiene and health of the most vulnerable people affected during the recent escalation.

To help hospitals to recover, we’re distributing 20,000 litres of fuel, and continuing to provide essential medical supplies. We’ll also be rebuilding over 100 damaged and deteriorated homes.

We welcome the ceasefire, but the suffering is far from over in Gaza, as families struggle with unclean water, a lack of healthcare, and the utter destruction of the infrastructure needed to help them rebuild.

Please donate, and help Gaza to heal.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Thank you,

JakaAllah khair
newsletter@humanappeal.org.uk
The Human Appeal Team
